Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • Canvas

  • public final class Canvas
extends java.lang.Object
    The instance of class Canvas (singleton) serves as a virtual canvas, on which the shapes can be painted.

    The class doesn't offer the public constructor to others because its instance should be a singleton to ensure that all shapes will be painted on the same canvas. The only way of getting the reference to canvas is calling the static factory method getCanvas().

    To allow a simple painting without some registration, the rubbed out parts of the painted shapes are not restored. If therefore is a part of another shape rubbed out as a side effect, the damaged shape should be repainted explicitly.

    Version:
    1.01.4240 — 2012-10-13
    Author:
    Rudolf PECINOVSKÝ

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the canvas, it means that it erases all the shapes on the canvas.

      • clearCanvas

        public static void clearCanvas()
        Clears the canvas, it means that it erases all the shapes on the canvas. Rightly this method should be defined as instance method, however, because the instance is defined as a singleton the method is defined as static to allow to clear the canvas without obtaining the reference to its instance.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2,
                     NamedColor color)
        Draws a line with given starting and ending point and given color.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The horizontal coordinate of the start of the drawn line
        y1 - The vertical coordinate of the start of the drawn line
        x2 - The horizontal coordinate of the end of the drawn line
        y2 - The vertical coordinate of the end of the drawn line
        color - The color of the drawn line

        color - The color of the drawn text

      • erase

        public void erase(java.awt.Shape shape)
        Erases the given shape. However its instance still exist, it is only not visible, because it is panted by background color.
        Parameters:
        shape - Shape which should be erased.

      • fill

        public void fill(java.awt.Shape shape)
        Paints the given shape and fiil it by the canvas color.
        Parameters:
        shape - Shape which should be painted.

      • getBackgroundColor

        public NamedColor getBackgroundColor()
        Returns the current canvas color (= background color).
        Returns:
        Current background color

      • getCanvas

        public static Canvas getCanvas()
        The only method allowing to get reference to instance of canvas. However, because the instance is defined as a singleton, the method returns every time the reference to the same instance.
        Returns:
        The reference to the singleton instance of the class

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the canvas height in pixels.
        Returns:
        Pixel height of the canvas

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the canvas width in pixels.
        Returns:
        Pixel width of the canvas

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Indicates whether the canvas application window is visible. However even the visible windows can be hiden by another windows.
        Returns:
        If the window is visible, it returns true, otherwise it returns false
